dialog_nodes.title: Recommend from taste and texture preferences

generic.title: Recommend based on taste and texture

values.text: Here is a list of durian stalls in Singapore. Some of them also offer delivery to your home. To have a good experience, try selecting the durians yourself at the stall, have a conversation or negotiate with the seller and then sit down to savor it with your family and friends. After eating, rinse your fingers with the water running down the durian husk, your fingers will smell good!
https://www.google.com/maps/search/durian+stall+near+me/@1.372786,103.8879184,12z/data=!3m1!4b1

options.label: I want to contact Desmond or a durian master for other business
Please recommend based on taste and texture

values.text: I am Ah Seng, a virtual assistant for Durian King which is designed to answer your questions about durian.
What should I call you?
Hello, <? input.text ?>! It's lovely to meet you, a durian lover, I supposed? How can I help you today?

Prices of durian vary depending on the season and essentially supply and demand. Here is a link for more information with indicative prices as of June 2022. Please note, prices are always negotiable, and pay for what you want - the types and tastes that you would enjoy with your family and friends.
https://www.mrlifechanger.com/best-durian-price-singapore/
Type of Durian___Ave price per kg
D175 Red Prawn__43 to_58 /kg
Golden Phoenix__68 to 85 /kg
Old Tree Mao Shan Wang__89 to 98 /kg
D197 Mao Shan Wang__57 to_83/kg
D200 Black Thorn is The Most expensive
Golden Phoenix AKA: Jin Feng
lace of origin: Pahang and Johor

Despite being one of the smallest durians (it can be as small as a mango), this breed actually brings something new to the table with its strong pungent smell. Its known for its bitter taste, watery texture and pale yellow-white colour thats often mistaken for being rotten.
To identify it, the shell of the durian has sharp needle-like thorns, while the fruit is roundish and oval in shape.
The following varieties are sweet and creamy:
Red Prawn
Black Thorn
Green Bamboo
The King of durian is currently Mao Shan Wang, the favorite of most Singaporean durian lovers.
There is a big price difference for Mao Shan Wang vs the other durian varieties and you will want to pay for what you are really eating.

Though there are varieties that are both bitter and sweet, most people would prefer one predominant taste. If youre not super into the thorny king of fruits, youre probably only familiar with two breeds: Mao Shan Wang and D24. But believe it or not, there are actually hundreds of durian varieties in the world, mostly grown in Malaysia and Thailand.
To help you identify it, just take a picture of the durian husk (unopened) and let us predict what variety it is for you (if you have not already done it).
If you're happy with what you hear so far, please continue to explore comments about types, tastes, locations of sellers, and prices, or even consult the Durian Master.
We will call you at the appointed date and time of your choice. If not possible, we will contact via WhatsApp through your mobile number.  Thank you.
Mao Shan Wang AKA: Butter durian, Cat Mountain King, Rajah Kunyit
Place of origin: Kelatan, Pahang and Johor
Probably the most popular type of durian among Singaporeans besides the D24. Rich in taste and colour, Mao Shan Wang durians boast a creamy texture and leave a strong bittersweet taste in your mouth.
To distinguish them, look out for the pyramid-shaped thorns at the base of the stem. They also have a unique starfish-shaped pattern found at the base of the durian fruit.
Black Pearl AKA: Hei Zhen Zhu
Place of origin: Johor

One of the rarer durian species. As its name suggests, Black Pearl durians have small seeds and pale yellow flesh with grey undertones. Featuring a smooth and creamy flesh, it has a bittersweet taste that doesnt come off as overwhelming. To distinguish it, look out for a small shell with a stubby stem.

generic.title: What taste or texture do you prefer?

values.text: Green Bamboo AKA: Qing Zhu
Place of origin: Johor

Another sweet durian. This breed is popular for its buttery and fibrous flesh. When you pry it open, youll find a pale yellow, slightly greenish flesh and a trademark orange stem in the middle of the core.
These types are generally bittersweet in taste:
D197 Mao Shan Wang (strong bittersweet)
D24 Sultan (subtle bittersweet after-taste)
The following varieties are bittersweet and creamy;
D197 Mao Shan Wang
D24 Sultan
Black Pearl
The following varieties are generally sweet:
D24 Sultan (Bittersweet)
D198 Red Prawn (Sweet)
D13 (Fragrant sweet and sticky)

generic.title: Which variety or type would you like to know about?

values.text: Red Prawn AKA: Hong Xia, Ang Hei, Udang Merah, D175 Red Prawn
Place of origin: Pahang and Johor

For sweet durian lovers. The flesh of Red Pawn slightly differs from the others due to its vibrant reddish orange colour. Creamier and stickier than most durians, the taste of this durian depends largely on the age of the tree that it grew from.

Younger durian trees yield sweeter fruit, while the more mature trees produce more bitter fruit. Red Prawn durian shells are thick due to the wide core of the durian, so there might not be a lot of fruit.
D200 Black Thorn
Place of origin: Penang

The flesh of the Black Thorn is bright yellow and creamy and it has a sweet and custardy taste, similar to that of Mao Shan Wang  but not as rich and has a lighter texture. The tips of the thorns tend to be darker too, thus the name.
More expensive than Mao Shan Wang as supply is limited.
Black Thorn is crowned Champion in the World Durian Competition 2022:Malaysia edition. It came from a 40 years old tree in Penang.
The following varieties are bitter and watery:
Jin Feng or Golden Phoenix
XO is even alcoholic in taste
The following varieties are in general bitter:
Mao Shan Wan (bitter)
Black Thorn (intense bitter)
Golden Phoenix (Sharp bitter)

If you want to import good quality durians, you're encouraged to have a conversation with our durian domain expert, Desmond Fong. If you import more than 500 Kg in a container, a certificate of origins and quality certification of the varieties will also be provided. 

There are regulations around the importation of durians and the correct processes need to be followed for smooth deliveries of the durians.

Please be assured only the best quality durians will be selected, specially frozen and packed ready for retail in your country.
Desmond's email: DesmondFong@Yahoo.com
D24 AKA: Sultan
Place of origin: Johor, Pahang and Cameron Highlands

Before the Mao Shan Wang breed surged in popularity, the most famous breed back in the 90s was the D24 durians. D24 durians are a little less overwhelming in flavour and are known for their creamy texture and subtle bittersweet after-taste. If youre not that familiar with durians, this is a good introduction to the king of fruits.
The stem of the durian is shorter compared to other durians and it has a brown-coloured ring around the bottom of the stem.
Black Gold
Place of origin: Pahang

A durian breed thats a few grades higher than the popular Mao Shan Wang. Like Black Pearl durians, dark greyish undertones can be found on the flesh of Black Gold durians. It has a silky texture and an intense buttery, bitter aftertaste.
Good day to you! How can I help you today?

D13 AKA Singapore Red Prawn
Beautiful orange flesh, encased in a thick shell. The flesh was smooth and slightly firm to the touch, nary a wrinkle to be seen, and quite shiny. 

It was very orange, which contrasted nicely with the green shell.

The flavor was rosy, flowery, sweet, and a little bit vanilla.

Identifying Red Prawn: D13 and D175
At a glance, the two durians look very distinct.

D13 was green. The Johor-grown D175 Red Prawn was more brown, with a greenish base to the thorns(and not as grey/brown as when its grown in Penang).

The spikes were clearly different  D13 was more blocky, with hard flat sides to each pyramidal spine, while the Red Prawn spines were smaller and had sharper little tips. Although the thorns became teenier and teenier and they reached the apex, the whole fruit had thorns on it  no bald spot.

The D13 at first glance seemed almost as pointy as the Red Prawn, but it actually had a small flat spot on the bottom that made it easier to stand the durian upright, unlike the D175 Red Prawn which kept tipping over.
Welcome to "Know your Durian King"
